target.name: refresh
target.description: Clean all and rebuild

target.name: clean-all
target.description: Clean all DB, Catalina and caches data, logs, and runtime subdirectories and all specific files like .rej, .orig

target.name: clean-downloads
target.description: Clean all downloaded files

target.name: clean-data
target.description: Clean all DB data (Derby) under runtime/data

target.name: clean-logs
target.description: Clean all logs in runtime/logs

target.name: clean-output
target.description: Clean runtime/output directory

target.name: clean-xtra
target.description: Clean all other files like .rej, .orig, etc.

target.name: clean-catalina
target.description: Clean Catalina data in runtime/catalina/work

target.name: clean-cache
target.description: Clean the UtilCache file if errors found with old objects in the cache (Java runtime error something like 'local class incompatible')

target.name: clean-tempfiles
target.description: Remove files located in runtime/tempfiles (captcha, etc...)

target.name: clean-search-indexes
target.description: Remove search indexes (e.g. Lucene indexes) created under runtime/indexes

target.name: clean-uploads
target.description: Remove uploaded files

target.name: svninfo
target.description: Update the Release-revision info in the footer. Note that you need a valid Internet connection and Subversion connected to the OFBiz repository for that

target.name: gitinfo
target.description: Update the Git Branch-revision info in the footer.

target.name: build-dev
target.description: Patch sources in a dev environment if patch files are present in runtime/patches.

echo.message: You need svn version 1.7 or higher - attempting patch instead.

target.name: revert-dev
target.description: Revert patch files present in runtime/patches applied by build-dev.

target.name: build-test
target.description: Patch and build all sources for use in a test environment. On Windows you need to have patch.exe in the path and patch files must all be in dos format (CR+LF)

target.name: build-qa
target.description: Patch and build all sources for use in a qa environment. On Windows you need to have patch.exe in the path and patch files must all be in dos format (CR+LF)

target.name: build-production
target.description: Patch and build all sources for use in a live environment. On Windows you need to have patch.exe in the path and patch files must all be in dos format (CR+LF)

target.name: copy-dtds
target.description: For committers : Copy all dtds from OFBiz instance to website

target.name: start
target.description: Start OFBiz (use -Dportoffset=portNumber to shift all ports with the portNumber value)

target.name: start-secure
target.description: Same than start but pre-loading the notsoserial Java agent (from tools/security/notsoserial) to protect OFBiz from the Java deserialization vulnerability

target.name: start-batch
target.description: Start OFBiz as a separate process. Use -Dportoffset=portNumber to shift all ports with the portNumber value.

target.name: start-batch-secure
target.description: Same than start-batch but pre-loading the notsoserial Java agent (from tools/security/notsoserial) to protect OFBiz from the Java deserialization vulnerability

target.name: start-debug
target.description: Start OFBiz in debugging mode. It uses the 8091 port by default. Use -Dportoffset=portNumber to shift all ports with the portNumber value.

target.name: start-pos
target.description: Start OFBiz POS (Point of sale). Use -Dportoffset=portNumber to shift all ports with the portNumber value.

target.name: start-pos-secure
target.description: Same than start-pos but pre-loading the notsoserial Java agent (from tools/security/notsoserial) to protect OFBiz from the Java deserialization vulnerability

target.name: start-both
target.description: Start OFBiz in both Web and POS (Point of sale) modes. Use -Dportoffset=portNumber to shift all ports with the portNumber value.

target.name: start-both-secure
target.description: Same than start-both but pre-loading the notsoserial Java agent (from tools/security/notsoserial) to protect OFBiz from the Java deserialization vulnerability

target.name: stop
target.description: Stop OFBiz. Use -Dportoffset=portNumber to shift all ports with the portNumber value.

target.name: status
target.description: Display status of OFBiz. Use -Dportoffset=portNumber to shift all ports with the portNumber value.

target.name: load-demo
target.description: Load all data; meant for generic OFBiz development, testing, demonstration, etc purposes

target.name: load-demo-multitenant
target.description: Load all data needed for the multi-tenancy demonstration. Caution: this creates three databases, with each one loaded with all demo data.

target.name: load-seed
target.description: Load ONLY the seed data (not seed-initial, demo, ext* or anything else); meant for use after an update of the code to reload the seed data as it is generally maintained along with the code and needs to be in sync for operation

target.name: load-extseed
target.description: Load seed, seed-initial and ext data; meant for manual/generic testing, development, or going into production with a derived system based on stock OFBiz where the ext data basically replaces the demo data

target.name: load-exttest
target.description: Load seed, seed-initial, ext and ext-test data; meant for automated testing with a derived system based on stock OFBiz

target.name: load-readers
target.description: Load data using the command line argument data-readers that takes a comma separated list of readers (seed, seed-initial, demo, ext, ext-test, ext-demo). On Windows XP (at least) you need top wrap the parameters in double-quotes. For instance: ant load-readers "-Ddata-readers=seed,seed-initial,ext"

target.name: load-file
target.description: Load data using the command line argument 'data-file' to load data from a given file using the 'default' delegator or a delegator specified in the command line argument 'delegator'

target.name: load-tenant
target.description: Load data using tenantId, syntax eg: ant load-tenant -DtenantId=DEMO1 (needs multitenant=Y in general.properties)

target.name: load-all-tenants
target.description: Load data for all tenants, syntax eg: ant load-all-tenants (needs multitenant=Y in general.properties)

target.name: create-tenant
target.description: Create a new tenant in your environment, create the delegator, load initial data with admin-user and password (needs multitenant=Y in general.properties)

target.name: run-tests
target.description: Run OFBiz default tests; you have to manually execute 'ant load-demo' before (and if needed even clear your data before) and see results in runtime/logs/test-results/html/all-tests.html. Use -Dportoffset=portNumber to shift all ports with the portNumber value.

target.name: run-test
target.description: Run a single test, syntax eg: ant run-test -Dtest.component=service -Dtest.case=service-soap-tests

target.name: run-test-debug
target.description: Run a single test in debug mode, syntax eg: ant run-test-debug -Dtest.component=service -Dtest.case=service-soap-tests

target.name: run-test-suite
target.description: Run a single test suite, syntax eg: ant run-test-suite -Dtest.component=mycomponent -Dtest.suiteName=mytests

target.description: Run all configured tests, stopping/starting ofbiz between each test
